byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Christina Capecchi from Minneapolis; Trip Gabriel from White Plains; John Surico from New York; and Rebekah Zemansky from Phoenix.
byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and FARAH STOCKMAN

abstract: American presidential campaign, already viewed by many as repugnant, dominated by two unappealing candidates, has become even harder to tolerate as tawdry accusations of sexual abuse and adultery are flung back and forth; angry crowds at rallies for both Donald J Trump and Hillary Clinton express intensifying feelings of negativity and even despair.

headline.print_headline: Public Rattled as Campaign Turns Coarser
headline.main: Ripples From the ‘How Low Can They Go’ Campaign

snippet: As the run for president veered to Donald J. Trump’s treatment of women, and whether Bill Clinton’s was worse, Americans collectively shook their heads....
lead_paragraph: As the run for president veered to Donald J. Trump’s treatment of women, and whether Bill Clinton’s was worse, Americans collectively shook their heads.
